hydrateordiedrate:Config.Setting.Refrige: Refrigeration cooling amount for Medieval Expansion ice cooling. Does nothing if medieval expansion is not present.
hydrateordiedrate:Config.Setting.WellSpr: Well Spring Output Multiplier, multiplies daily liter output.
hydrateordiedrate:Config.Setting.RandomM: Random Multiplier Chance for aquifers, increase this to raise the chance of random aquifers appearing (not near sources of water)
hydrateordiedrate:Config.Setting.Step: Aquifer Step, increase the chunk distance aquifer calculation will check for neighbor chunks, heavy performance impact do not change unless you know what you are doing.
hydrateordiedrate:Config.Setting.WaterBl: Water Block Multiplier for aquifer rating, larger numbers will make aquifers near water heavier.
hydrateordiedrate:Config.Setting.SaltWat: Salt Water Multiplier for aquifer rating, larger numbers will make aquifers near salt water heavier. This WILL affect aquifer salinity do not change unless you know what you are doing.
hydrateordiedrate:Config.Setting.Boiling: Boiling Water Multiplier for aquifer rating, larger numbers will make aquifers near hot springs (boiling water) heavier.
hydrateordiedrate:Config.Setting.Aquifer: Random Multiplier Chance for Aquifers: Increase this value to raise the chance of random aquifers appearing away from water sources.
Aquifer Step: Defines the distance between chunks that will be checked for neighboring aquifers. Changing this may have a significant performance impact.
Water Block Multiplier: Increases the aquifer rating based on the number of nearby water blocks.
Salt Water Multiplier: Increases the aquifer rating near salt water. Note that changing this value will affect aquifer salinity.
Boiling Water Multiplier: Enhances the aquifer rating when near hot springs (boiling water).
hydrateordiedrate:Config.Setting.Prospec: The chunk radius that will be checked when prospecting for aquifers
hydrateordiedrate:Config.Setting.WaterPe: Set to false to remove water transition entirely so new water types will never perish into regular water
hydrateordiedrate:Config.Setting.setting: Max aquifer rating above sea level
hydrateordiedrate:Config.Setting.SprintT: Sprint + Right Click to drink istead of Sneak + Right click, for ease of use with CarryOn
hydrateordiedrate:Config.Setting.Aquifer: Print Current Chunk aquifer information on node made rather than density search.
hydrateordiedrate:Config.Setting.ShowAqu: Include Aquifer data on auto generated prospecting map markers
hydrateordiedrate:Config.Setting.WinchOu: Show On Hover output info when looking at winch. Displays the output of the wellspring directly below the winch (up to 256 blocks away)
hydrateordiedrate:survivalinfo-thirst-te:
Thirst
Feeling parched? Your survival now depends on more than just food!

The Thirst Mechanic adds a new survival challenge to your adventures. Stay hydrated or face the consequences!

Thirst Bar: Keep an eye on your thirst bar, which gradually depletes over time. Hot climates cause thirst to drain even faster, so manage your hydration carefully when traveling to the south!

Weather Influence: Hot temperatures cause faster thirst depletion. Wear cooling clothes or seek shelter to help slow down the drain. Being wet also helps cool you down, and sometimes wearing less clothing can be the better option.

DEATH: Failing to stay hydrated will result in death—and quickly! Thirst damage is approximately double that of starvation.

Liquid Encumbrance: Carrying more than 4 (default) litres of liquid in a container will slow down your movement. Plan your liquid storage wisely.

Hydration from Food & Drinks: Every food and drink item now has a hydration stat. Special items like soups and juices will temporarily pause thirst, while alcohol provides an even longer reprieve, thanks to the unique way Seraphs process it.

Water Sources: Drink directly from water sources by holding down shift + rightmouse on a liquid block. However, drinking this way increases hunger, so processing drinks or making soups is a more efficient method of hydration. Saltwater is extremely unsafe to drink, so be careful when sourcing water from the wild.

Rain Water Collection: All liquid containers can now collect rainwater when placed outside during a storm. Rainwater is a great early to mid-game resource as it replenishes more thirst and reduces hunger at half the rate of regular water.

Kegs: You can craft Kegs from wood, sticks, and iron hoops. Initially untapped, they are used for long-term liquid storage. To tap a keg, forge a Keg Tap from Brass and hammer it into place with the tap in hand and a hammer in your off-hand (Hold rightmouse). This allows you to both add and remove liquids from the keg. Remember, kegs can be recycled with an axe (Hold rightmouse), though there’s a chance some metal may be lost in the process.

Nutrition Deficit: Be mindful of liquids with negative saturation values, as they can cause a Nutrition Deficit, shown as an orange marker on your saturation bar. While you have any nutrition deficit, food will not provide any nutrition. Every bit of satiation you consume will gradually reduce the deficit until it reaches zero.

Wells: Establish wells to secure a steady supply of water. Their efficiency is influenced by natural aquifers, which are typically stronger near water and hot springs. For a detailed explanation on well construction and management, visit Wells.
hydrateordiedrate:wellinfo-text:
Wells

Aquifer strength varies by region; they are typically more potent near bodies of water and hot springs, though you might occasionally stumble upon an unexpectedly strong source. The stronger the aquifer, the deeper you must dig to reach it, with the most heaviest aquifers found only near the bottom of the world (configurable).

To tap into these natural resources, switch your pickaxe to its well mode and dig a well spring. The well’s shaft will begin to fill with water at a rate that reflects the local aquifer strength (which you can assess using a prospecting pick). The shaft must be unobstructed and have a solid as each horizontal neighbor at each level. However, caution is advised: wells can become tainted if something dies within them or even poisoned by an enemy if a death cap mushroom is thrown into it.

Your choice of building materials also matters. Constructing the well shaft from Clay Bricks (Any Color) adds two extra blocks of water storage (configurable), while using Stone Bricks (Any Stone Type) can boost the capacity by up to five extra blocks—for a total of ten blocks. Each block holds 70 liters of water and will gradually regenerate as the well refills over time.

Currently, if your wellspring is too far underground, you can build a Well Winch to draw water conveniently from the surface!
hydrateordiedrate:config-thirst-text:
Hydrate Or Diedrate Configuration
Customize every aspect of your hydration survival experience!

Thirst Settings:
- MaxThirst: Sets the maximum thirst level a player can have. Default: 1500.
- ThirstDamage: Determines the amount of damage taken per tick due to thirst. Default: 1 damage per tick.
- ThirstDecayRate: Base hydration decay per tick. This value is multiplied by factors such as movement. Default: 10.
- HydrationLossDelayMultiplier: Hydration loss duration multiplier for drinks. Higher values increase the delay before hydration starts depleting after drinking. Default: 0.05.
- EnableThirstMechanics: Toggles the thirst mechanic on or off.
- WaterSatiety: Satiety loss (negative) or gain (positive) from regular water (inventory only, not source block). See block hydration config for source block settings.
- SaltWaterSatiety: Satiety loss (negative) or gain (positive) from salt water (inventory only, not source block). See block hydration config for source block settings.
- BoilingWaterSatiety: Satiety loss (negative) or gain (positive) from boiling water (inventory only, not source block). See block hydration config for source block settings.
- RainWaterSatiety: Satiety loss (negative) or gain (positive) from rain water (inventory only, not source block). See block hydration config for source block settings.
- DistilledWaterSatiety: Satiety loss (negative) or gain (positive) from distilled water (inventory only, not source block). See block hydration config for source block settings.
- SprintThirstMultiplier: Multiplier for thirst decay rate while sprinting. Default: 150% or 1.5.
- EnableBoilingWaterDamage: Toggles damage when attempting to drink boiling water.
- BoilingWaterDamage: Damage taken for drinking boiling water. Default: 5 damage.

Movement Speed Penalty Settings:
- MaxMovementSpeedPenalty: Movement speed reduction cap from being thirsty. Set to 1 to disable penalties.
- MovementSpeedPenaltyThreshold: Thirst level below which movement speed penalties begin to apply. Scaling starts from this point to zero based on the max movement speed penalty.

Liquid Encumbrance Settings:
- EnableLiquidEncumbrance: Toggles movement penalties from carrying liquids.
- EncumbranceLimit: How many liters a single inventory slot must exceed before liquid encumbrance is triggered.
- LiquidEncumbranceMovementSpeedDebuff: Movement speed reduction applied due to liquid encumbrance. Default: 40% or 0.4.

Temperature and Heat Settings:
- HarshHeat: Toggles whether high temperatures impact thirst.
- TemperatureThreshold: Temperature above which thirst increases faster.
- ThirstIncreasePerDegreeMultiplier: Governs how much thirst decay rate increases per degree above the temperature threshold.
- HarshHeatExponentialGainMultiplier: Overall thirst increase in extreme heat. This value is highly sensitive to change.
- ThirstDecayRateMax: Maximum thirst decay rate in hot environments. Default: 500% or 5.0.

Cooling Factors:
- UnequippedSlotCooling: Cooling from empty equipment slots. Each valid empty clothing slot provides cooling equivalent to the cooling stat on clothing.
- WetnessCoolingFactor: Cooling effect from being wet.
- ShelterCoolingFactor: Cooling effect from being under shelter. Shelters are base-game rooms.
- SunlightCoolingFactor: Governs how much cooling is impacted by sunlight exposure. Higher values make shade more effective.
- DiurnalVariationAmplitude: Time-of-day cooling effect.
- RefrigerationCooling: Cooling provided by refrigeration system from medieval expansion ice.

XSkills Settings:
- DromedaryMultiplierPerLevel: Thirst reduction per Dromedary level.
- EquatidianCoolingMultipliers: Cooling multipliers for equatorial regions.

Rain Gathering Settings:
- EnableRainGathering: Toggle rainwater collection.
- RainMultiplier: Adjust rainwater collection rate.
- EnableParticleTicking: Toggle rainwater particle effects.

Keg Settings:
- KegCapacityLitres: Max capacity of a keg.
- SpoilRateUntapped: Spoilage rate for untapped kegs.
- SpoilRateTapped: Spoilage rate for tapped kegs.
- KegIronHoopDropChance: Chance for iron hoops to drop when recycling.
- KegTapDropChance: Chance for a keg tap to drop when recycling.

Tun Settings:
- TunCapacityLitres: Max capacity of a tun.
- TunSpoilRateMultiplier: Spoilage rate multiplier for a tun.
hydrateordiedrate:block-wellspring-descr: A hand-dug spring that allows filtered water to seep through from nearby water or aquifers.
hydrateordiedrate:blockhelp-winch-addrem: Add or remove a bucket. (Must be raised all the way up!)
achievement-hoddrinkwater-desc: I'm a civilized person, I drink my pond water from a cup
achievement-hoddrinkboiledwater-desc: It's still got bits floating in it, but at least it won't make me sick
achievement-hoddrinkdistilledwater-desc: Now that's what I call high quality H2O
achievement-hoddrinkrainwater-desc: Some people feel the rain. Others just get wet
achievement-hoddrinkboiledrainwater-desc: And other people boil it for sanitary reasons
achievement-hoddrinkfreshwellwater-desc: When the well's dry, we know the worth of water
achievement-hoddrinktaintedwellwater-des: It tastes like something died in it!
achievement-hodplacewellwinch-desc: Don't wait until you're thirsty to dig a well
achievement-hodplacetun-desc: *Slaps Tun* This baby can fit so much liquid.
aquifer-no-data: No aquifer data available for this region.
aquifer-direction: The aquifer seems to get stronger to the {0}.
aquifer-command-cleared: Aquifer data has been cleared successfully.
setaquifer-description: Sets the aquifer rating for the current chunk.
setaquifer-failed: Failed to set aquifer rating. The current chunk may not be loaded.
getaquifer-description: Retrieves the aquifer rating for the current chunk.
getaquifer-not-found: No aquifer data found for the current chunk.
cmd.setnutridef.desc: Sets the player's nutrition deficit (hunger reduction) level.
cmd.sethydlossdelay.desc: Sets the player's hydration loss delay.
cmd.getnutridef.desc: Gets the player's nutrition deficit (hunger reduction) level.
cmd.gethydlossdelay.desc: Gets the player's hydration loss delay.
cmd.nutridefset: Nutrition deficit set to {0} for player '{1}'.
cmd.hydlossdelayset: Hydration loss delay set to {0} for player '{1}'.
cmd.getthirst: Value for thirst is {0} for player '{1}'.
cmd.gethydlossdelay: Hydration loss delay is {0} for player '{1}'.
itemkegtap-requireshammer: Requires a hammer in the off hand
waterinteraction-handsfree: You must have both hands free to drink.
